title.native: ウマ娘 プリティーダービー

description:
In a world very much like our own, great race horses of the past have a chance to be reborn as "horse girls"—girls with the ears and tails of horses as well as their speed and endurance. The best of these horse girls go to train at Tokyo's Tracen Academy, hopefully moving on to fame and fortune as both racers and idols.

Special Week, a high school horse girl from the countryside, has just transferred to Tracen, and she's determined to fulfill her promise to her mother to become the best horse girl in Japan. On her way to school, she takes a pit stop at the race track and instantly falls in love with Silence Suzuka's style, becoming determined to race on the same team as her.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: สาวม้าโมเอะ

tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description: __UTAMARO Movement__ is a Japanese recording unit known as a composer, arranger and trackmaker. They are known to frequently collaborate with [Taro Iwashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/100948/Taro-Iwashiro).

__Height:__ 158 cm
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Profile (Aoni)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/kohno-marika.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/marika_0222) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/marika_kohno/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marika_Kouno) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高野麻里佳)

She is part of the seiyuu idol group [**Earphones**](https://anilist.co/staff/195973/) (イヤホンズ) with fellow voice actresses [Rie Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/119331) and [Yuki Nagaku](https://anilist.co/staff/119370), originally formed for the anime [Sore ga Seiyuu!](https://anilist.co/anime/21009).

**Non-anime roles:**
• Primavera - Memento Mori (VG)

[Official Website](https://machi.co/) | [Official Blog](https://ameblo.jp/miumachi10/) | [Profile (Horipro)](http://www.horipro-international.com/artist/machico) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MachicoOfficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/machico_3s25/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machico_(singer)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machico)

Machiko Saitou, better known by her stage name Machico, is a Japanese singer and voice actress from Hiroshima Prefecture who is currently affiliated with the Horipro talent agency. 

After participating in an audition organized by Horipro, she made her music debut in 2012, singing a theme song for a PC game. She was cast as the character Tsubasa Ibuki in the mobile game The Idolmaster: Million Live! in 2013. Apart from voice acting, she has performed theme songs for KonoSuba and Age 12. Machico released two albums between 2014 and 2015, and opened her official fanclub in late 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayakaohashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayaka_ohashi/)

A voice actor, singer, and the drummer of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Ayaka was born in Saitama Prefecture but moved to Tokyo after kindergarten. She became part of a theater company in elementary school and appeared in commercials, stage productions, and TV dramas. After receiving some voice acting lessons in the company, she realized that she wanted to become a voice actress. She got scouted in 2011 by Horipro and began her career. In August 2014, she debuted as a singer with her single "YES!!", which was used as the opening theme for the anime _Sabagebu!_.

Her hobbies includes karaoke as well as watching anime, drumming, browsing the internet, gaming, watching sports, and reading light novels. She had drumming skills prior to joining the _Bang Dream_ franchise. Ayaka loves heavy metal and shares her love together with her mother, who used to sing Marilyn Manson's songs for her as lullabies. Her favorite bands are Evanescence, Papa Roach, and Slipknot. She also admires [Nana Mizuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95081/). 

Ayaka is also the voice provider of the VOCALOID4 voicebank, MATCHA.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Iansan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Angelina - Arknights (VG)

__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Official Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/ueda-hitomi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Weeeda_I)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Brid - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- iDoll Flower - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Zani - Wuthering Waves (VG)

__Hobbies:__ Games, eating, tennis, swimming

[Website](https://columbia.jp/wakiazumi) | [Talent Page](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=12722) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/azumi_waki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ajujustaff) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/azumi_waki)

On August 10, 2023, she announced on Twitter her marriage to her longtime partner met through a shared hobby of gaming.
